sentences.en: a highly subjective point of view
A literary critic should not be too subjective in his approach.
sentences.cn: 文学评论家的看法不应太主观.

sentences.en: Again, is personal morality subjective or can it be assessed by an absolute standard?
sentences.cn: 同样, 个人道德观是否是主观的?可否用一种绝对的标准来衡量它?

sentences.en: Any comparison that is not strictly factual runs the risk of being interpreted as subjective.
sentences.cn: 任何不完全切合实际的比较都有可能被当作主观臆断。

sentences.en: As a critic, he is far too subjective.
sentences.cn: 作为评论家，他过于主观。

sentences.en: Be careful to avoid being subjective and one - sided.
Handle may be defined as a subjective tactile evaluation of the textile quality.
sentences.cn: 手感可定义为织物质量的触觉评价方法.

sentences.en: Human perception is highly imperfect and by definition subjective.
sentences.cn: 人的感知具有高度缺陷，而且天性主观。

sentences.en: Subjective judgments based on frequency graphs vary greatly from cartographer to cartographer.
sentences.cn: 根据频率图所作的主观判断,因编图人员不同而变化甚大.

sentences.en: Taxonomy is very largely subjective and intuitive.
sentences.cn: 分类学大体上是很主观和直观的.

sentences.en: The Kantian categories differ from those of Aristotle in being subjective.
sentences.cn: 康德哲学的范畴与亚里士多德哲学的范畴的不同在于其主观性.

sentences.en: The way they interpreted their past was highly subjective.
sentences.cn: 他们解释其过去的方式太主观。

sentences.en: This is a subjective judgement of her abilities.
sentences.cn: 这是对她能力的一种主观判断.

sentences.en: Try to avoid being subjective and one - sided when looking at problems.
sentences.cn: 看问题要避免主观 片面.

sentences.en: We know that taste in art is a subjective matter.
sentences.cn: 我们知道艺术品位因人而异。

sentences.en: We should not put subjective reasons on a par with objective reasons in our analysis.
sentences.cn: 不能把客观原因与主观原因平列起来分析.

words.tran_cn: 服从的；易患…的；受制于…的
主题；科目；[语] 主语；国民
自私的,自我中心的,内向的,偏狭的,自信的

trans.tran_en: a state-ment, report, attitude etc that is subjective is influenced by personal opinion and can therefore be unfair
